reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very close to Train station-walkable within 3 mins..
reviews.title: well placed

likes.liked: — Conveniece for sight seeing, Clean and tidy.
likes.disliked: — No air conditioning in winter- too hot on warm days!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Central to all tourist attractions, all within walking distance.
reviews.title: Absolutely horrible dont go!
Not a good place to stay!
reviews.text: Hotel basic, but had no problem with room or cleanliness of Hotel, and staff were friendly.

We arrived at the hotel and the room was nothing like the photos made out. The room was approximately 3m x 3m and the floor and surfaces absolutely filthy. The television was foriegn and so no english satalite tv. The floor of the whole room flooded when the crap shower was used. The mini bar had a bottle of water and a can of coke and nothing else. The hairdrier was useless and in addition there was no tea or coffee making facilities. The walls were so thin you could hear all the traffic adjacent and everyone else in the hotel, therefore got no sleep in 3 nights. They make you pay up front before you see the room and so you are so annoyed when you see your room because they wont return your money. The breakfast buffet consists of tea or coffee and to eat you can have egg or toast with cheese or ham. The staff are not at all helpful and are so so rude. It would struggle to get 2 stars never mind 4 star ! Please do not go at all, we enquired into other 4 star hotels while we were there and you can get so much more for less money and we know because we asked to see the rooms and we wish we had booked various other hotels before Champagne Palace. Do not go the place is a disgusting hostel nevermind a hotel. I read other reviews before booking the hotel and i thought "well the photos and things look ok so maybe they have refurbished the hotel" Well they really havent, its horrid do not go to this hotel please!!!
reviews.title: Horrible, Horrible Hotel!!! Stay Away!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at the Champagne Palace was booked through [--] and the pics looked ok online. The pics online are not typical of the rooms! The rooms are very small, dirty carpets, mold and mildew on the walls in the room, as well as the bathroom and shower. The location was close to Termini Station, but that is all I can say good about it. It is in a very low class area of town, and our tour guide was shocked to find out that we were staying there. The staff was not helpful at all, except to recommend a relative's place for lunch or dinner. When we needed ice for a sprained ankle, they said there was no ice whatsoever in the hotel, nor at restaurants nearby! When we asked for a voucher that had been faxed by a shuttle company for getting to the airport, the staff replied they had not received a fax. This happened 3 times, and the shuttle company finally asked that we call them when we were at the desk so that we could see the fax come in...that's the only way we were able to get the voucher. As it turns out, the staff wanted us to use their own shuttle, which cost more, so they would trash the faxes as they came in! The staff did not speak good English, were not helpful with suggestions of tours or anything. I would certainly not recommend anyone to stay at this hotel.
reviews.title: Worst Experience

reviews.text: This hotel was quite convenient to the main train terminal, lots of shopping, and the Coliseum wasn't that far of a walk. The hotel was merely adequate, yet the desk clerks were friendly, just didn't go out of their way to accomdate us in any way. It's no frills . We were part of a group so I don't know how the rates compare.
reviews.title: Basic and Convenient

likes.disliked: — never got TV to work, no offer to help, floor not clean, very loud street noise

reviews.text: Stayed here for three nights in July. On the plus side, it is very close to the train station so it is easy to only haul your bags a block or two when arriving or departing, the room was small but clean and the staff was helpful with directions and information. On the negative side, it was rather expensive for what you get. We paid 120 euro/night. Also, the area around the hotel is not the greatest, it's far from typical Rome attractions if you don't want to take the metro and the room is really small...even by european standards. I might stay here again but I think I would check out some other locations first. If you are just looking for a place close to the station and don't care about the price then it's probably ok for you. This was the most expensive place we stayed at throughout our entire trip.
reviews.title: Close to Train Station

likes.disliked: — Close to train station and expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel location was excellent. It was very easy to go and see attractions etc. But hotel staff was horrible. I haven't had this kind of service anywhere. They don't understand and speak english so it is impossible to solve any problems with them. And somebody, I guess cleaner actually stole my frequent flyer bonus card. Just wondering what he/she is going to do with it :D Just horrible service.
reviews.title: terrible experience

reviews.text: Most annoying was that they cleaned rooms normally not until late afternoon so often we came back from our tourist walk and noticed that room is not yet cleaned.
reviews.title: Terrible hotel - very bad experiencia

reviews.text: Shower was bad, water temperature changed from warm to cold constantly during the shower. And rooms, they were SMALL. I mean... SMALL. Also I don't recommended using that elevator, I don't think it's very safe. Air conditioning is off when you're not in the room so beware that the room may be warm when you return from your tour.
reviews.title: Be carefully !!!!

reviews.text: Tripadvisors - do not be fooled by the name. This ain't no shangri-la for your Roman Holiday. This is not what discerning travellers would call a four star hotel!
reviews.title: Champagne causes headaches

likes.liked: — Although small the rooms were plushly furnished and comfy

reviews.text: Instead there are a number of very specific problems with this hotel that you should be made aware of before parting with the considerable sum of money you'd need to stay here.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A lift which can only accommodate four people is not sufficient for a hotel which has seven floors. It frequently broke down, leaving elderly guests to fend for themselves.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A buffet breakfast was of quite the poorest quality I have ever witnessed and certainly not befitting of a four star hotel. Staff who were plainly running late were surly when people turned up at the official opening time and dished out chipped plates and glassware. Hot drinks were like dishwater. I am not satisfied that the fare was fresh and was served up with such bad grace, I ultimately chose to breakfast outwith the hotel. And there is NO coffee shop or bar within the hotel, contrary to publicity material on every online site I read.
reviews.title: A Very Enjoyable Stay

likes.disliked: — Steps in, which means people with disabilities wouldn't be able to use it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The maid service was woefully slow – it was the norm for a room to lie unattended to until well after 3pm. Why does a four star hotel consider this acceptable?
reviews.title: Why all the fuss?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived late ish and was greeted with very friendly staff. The rooms are small, typically European, with a nice bathroom. The bed was comfortable and large and the room was clean. The room had air-conditioning but it was quite loud. We found that the room did keep quite cool at night without the air-con. The location we found, very convenient as it is very easy to get anywhere in Rome from the train station area.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but too much noise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was the typical continental European, coffee, pastries and bread and meats, simple but very nice. The breakfast room was on the top floor and the view was really very pleasant. When we had any questions on where to eat or where things are the staff very really very helpful.
reviews.title: This is a terrible hotel by all standards. I will not give it any star rating.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So in short a great place to stay, if it had not been so noisy! Every night at about 5am it sounded like a train ran through the hotel we came to the conclusion that it was the cleaners moving a trolley or something, but that let it down really. We did not complain because we only stayed there for 3 nights, but if we had done any longer, we would have because it would wake you up. This is a real shame because other than that we felt the hotel was pretty good!
reviews.title: Hated it, filthy, moldy, and dirty. Not as advertised!!!

likes.liked: — Checking Out & Train station being close.

reviews.text: This hotel is OK if you don't mind a dusty room which was never cleaned for the 8 nights of stay but one (after shouting loud). You should remember to bring your bed linen along ( Blankets, duvet-cover and some sheets).
reviews.title: keep this brand of champagne on ice

likes.liked: — the stunning views of rome from the breakfast room
likes.disliked: — the poor attitude to customer service

reviews.text: Air ducts are all blocked and so what you have is circulation of stale air and dust in the room. Keep your window open, then comes the noise from the traffic. I was lucky to be on the 6th floor after experiencing a third floor accommodation.
reviews.title: 10 sqm rooms in this 4* hotel!!!!
